snippet: Negotiations have barely begun for a trade pact between the United States and Europe, but the business lobbying is well under way, in both Brussels and Washington.
abstract: Negotiations have barely begun for potentially sweeping trade pact between the United States and Europe, but business lobbying is well under way on both sides of the Atlantic; potential deal  will apply to nearly a billion people who live in combined markets and make it easier for products to be traded between Europe and the United States, as they would presumably have to pass only one regulatory test instead of two.

byline.original: By DANNY HAKIM and ERIC LIPTON
byline.contributor: Danny Hakim reported from London, and Eric Lipton from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Negotiations have barely begun for a trade pact between the United States and Europe, but the business lobbying is well under way, in both Brussels and Washington.

headline.main: U.S.-European Trade Talks Inch Ahead Amid Flurry of Corporate Wish Lists
headline.print_headline: U.S.-European Trade Talks Inch Ahead Amid Flurry of Corporate Wish Lists
